# ## 2h. Evidence - Reliability QAS Measurements
# 
# Measure reliability in the context of input variations.
# 
# The cell below must contain JSON data about this evidence that will be used to automatically populate the sample test catalog.

# ### Initialize MLTE Context
# 
# MLTE contains a global context that manages the currently active _session_. Initializing the context tells MLTE how to store all of the artifacts that it produces. This import will also set up global constants related to folders and model to use.

# Sets up context for the model being used, sets up constants related to folders and model data to be used.
from session import *


# ### Set up scenario test case

from mlte.negotiation.artifact import NegotiationCard

card = NegotiationCard.load()
qa = 7
print(card.quality_scenarios[qa])


# **A Specific test case generated from the scenario:**
# 
# **Data and Data Source:**	Test dataset needs to include entries that are intended to fail, generated based on Equivalence Testing and Boundary Testing.
# 
# **Measurement and Condition:**	Log entries are produced for all erroneous inputs.
# 
# **Context:**	Normal Operation

# ### Helper Functions
# 
# Prepare all functions and data for the measurements.

# Load model module
from utils import model_predict

# from utils import garden


def run_and_get_log() -> str:
    \"\"\"Runs the model and gets the log.\"\"\"
    model_predict.run_model(OOD_DATASET_DIR, MODEL_FILE_PATH)

    return model_predict.load_log()


# Load model module
from utils import model_predict
from utils import garden


def run_and_get_log() -> str:
    \"\"\"Runs the model and gets the log.\"\"\"
    model_predict.run_model(SAMPLE_DATASET_DIR, MODEL_FILE_PATH)

    return model_predict.load_log()


# ### Measurements
# 
# Finally, we execute the measurements and store the results.

from mlte.measurement.external_measurement import ExternalMeasurement
from mlte.evidence.types.string import String

# Evaluate, identifier has to be the same one defined in the TestSuite.
measurement = ExternalMeasurement(
    \"input format validation error\", String, run_and_get_log
)
result = measurement.evaluate()

# Inspect value
# print(result)

# Save to artifact store
result.save(force=True)
